channel.title: Bloomberg Technology

item.title: Jump India Said to Hire Akhtar From IMC in Top Technology Role
item.description: Jump India, the local arm of global market maker Jump Trading, has hired Javed Akhtar to lead its technology division, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Savio Shetty

media:content.media:description: Fiber optic cables, center, and copper Ethernet cables feed into switches inside a communications room at an office in London, U.K., on Monday, May 21, 2018. The Department of Culture, Media and Sport will work with the Home Office to publish a white paper later this year setting out legislation, according to a statement, which will also seek to force tech giants to reveal how they target abusive and illegal online material posted by users. Photographer: Jason Alden/Bloomberg

item.title: A Musk-Telegram AI Pact Sets the Stage for More Drama
item.description: Conspiracy theories and extremism on Pavel Durov’s freewheeling app could be supercharged by a deep integration with AI chatbot Grok.
item.dc:creator: Parmy Olson

media:content.media:description: Sorting out the details.

item.title: NetEase Shares Near Record High as China’s Gen Z Embraces Games
item.description: NetEase Inc. shares are closing in on their first new all-time high in over four years, as a wave of youthful consumerism adds to a host of positives for China’s game stocks.
item.dc:creator: Henry Ren, Sangmi Cha

item.title: Synopsys Suspends Guidance After US Notice on Export Curbs
item.description: Synopsys Inc., a top maker of chip-design software, suspended its financial guidance for the current quarter and fiscal year after receiving word from the US government about new restrictions on exports to China.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Synopsys headquarters in Mountain View, California.

item.title: NTT Docomo to Buy SBI’s Online Bank for $2.9 Billion
item.description: NTT Docomo Inc. is buying SBI Holdings Inc.’s online bank in a ¥420 billion ($2.9 billion) deal to shore up the Japanese mobile carrier’s financial offerings in a hyper-competitive market.
item.dc:creator: Kazu Hirano, Yuki Furukawa

media:content.media:description: An NTT Docomo Inc. store in Tokyo. Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg

item.title: Dell Annual Profit Outlook Tops Estimates on AI Server Boost
item.description: Dell Technologies Inc. gave a profit outlook for the year that exceeded estimates and said it had seen a significant increase in orders for servers to run AI networks.
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: Dell Technologies headquarters in Round Rock, Texas.

item.title: Nvidia Shrugs Off China Concerns With Upbeat Forecast | Bloomberg Technology 5/29/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Nvidia surpassing Microsoft as the most valuable company, after investors shrugged off concerns about China-related curbs. Plus, Informatica’s CEO explains what is driving Salesforce's $8 billion acquisition of the company. And Tesla targets June 12 to launch its robotaxi service in Austin, as Elon Musk steps back from his government role. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Microsoft Touts AI Sales at Town Hall, Reveals Barclays Contract
item.description: Microsoft Corp. touted its progress selling artificial intelligence tools to corporate customers during a companywide town hall on Thursday, including a major deal with Barclays Plc.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: A customer uses a computer with Microsoft Copilot+ PC in Union City, California.

item.title: OpenAI, Anthropic Prepare for a New Era of AI Products
item.description: Leading AI labs are now working to turn their technical advances into compelling apps and hardware devices. But first...
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Sam Altman, chief executive officer of OpenAI Inc., during a Senate Commerce, Science, and Transportation Committee hearing in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, May 8, 2025. The leaders of some of the biggest technology and artificial intelligence companies will go to Congress on Thursday with a wish list of sorts that at its top has doing away with regulation they say inhibits their firms’ growth and by default, sends business to China. Photographer: Nathan Howard/Bloomberg

item.title: Disney+ Expands Subscriber Perks, Including Movie Premieres
item.description: Hulu customers can also win TV show and concert tickets
item.dc:creator: Thomas Buckley

media:content.media:description: The Disney+ website on a smartphone in the Brooklyn borough of New York, US, on Monday, July 18, 2022. Walt Disney Co.'s ESPN will raise the price of its streaming service by 43% next month, betting that it can help cover the escalating cost of sports rights without losing subscribers who are grappling with soaring inflation. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: The Podcast About Podcasts That’s Becoming a Cult Podcast
item.description: Talking Talk is taking the burgeoning podcast industry seriously and finding a growing audience on Instagram
item.dc:creator: Ashley Carman

media:content.media:description: Roommates and childhood friends Peter Ditzler and Cam George host their Talking Talk podcast from their living room in Los Angeles

item.title: Mobile-Game Makers Poised for Windfall Following Win Over Apple
item.description: Mobile-game developers may reap billions of dollars more in revenue this year as a result of a court ruling freeing them from rules imposed by Apple Inc.’s App Store.
item.dc:creator: Cecilia D'Anastasio

media:content.media:description: The Apple App Store. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Meta Teams Up With Anduril to Make AI-Powered Military Products
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. is partnering with defense contractor Anduril Industries Inc. to develop new products for the US military, including an artificial intelligence-powered helmet with virtual and augmented reality features.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Wagner, Riley Griffin

media:content.media:description: The Anduril Industries headquarters in Costa Mesa, California, US, on Thursday, Dec. 14, 2023. Anduril recently beat several legacy defense players in a contest for a major contract to develop an unmanned fighter jet for the US Air Force and is now valued at $8.5 billion. Photographer: Kyle Grillot/Bloomberg

item.title: Hydro for Data Centers Beats Gas From Alberta, Says Bell AI Boss
item.description: Oil and gas hub Alberta made a big pitch in 2024 to supply power for AI data centers. It didn’t convince BCE Inc., which is setting up one of the first major systems in the country.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Seal

media:content.media:description: Mirko Bibic, president and chief executive officer of BCE Inc. and Bell Canada, at the Web Summit conference in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, on Wednesday, May 28, 2025. The annual conference gathers key industry figures in technology.

item.title: Nvidia Faces Bipartisan Concern Over Chinese Facility Report
item.description: Republican Senator Jim Banks and Democrat Elizabeth Warren are demanding answers from Nvidia Corp. CEO Jensen Huang on his firm’s reported plans to open a research facility in Shanghai, saying the decision “raises significant national security and economic security concerns.”
item.dc:creator: Steven T. Dennis

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang

item.title: Telegram Raises $1.7 Billion Convertible Bond for Debt Swap
item.description: Telegram raised $1.7 billion from convertible bonds that it will use to retire existing debt and lengthen the maturity of its debt.
item.dc:creator: Olga Voitova

item.title: Chicago’s Wealthy Back Bay Area Fund for University Startups
item.description: A Silicon Valley venture capital firm has lured investment from billionaires including Don Wilson, Michael Polsky and Ashley Duchossois Joyce to fund University of Chicago technology startups.
item.dc:creator: Miranda Davis

media:content.media:description: The University of Chicago campus.

item.title: Michael Cembalest on Why AI Is the Stock Market Bet of the Century
item.description: A chat with JPMorgan Asset Management's cult analyst.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang, co-founder and chief executive officer of Nvidia Corp., during the Computex conference in Taipei, Taiwan, on Monday, May 19, 2025. Nvidia unveiled the latest raft of technologies aimed at sustaining the boom in demand for AI computing — and ensuring that its products stay at the center of the action. Photographer: Annabelle Chih/Bloomberg

item.title: Odd Lots: Michael Cembalest Says AI Is Bet of Century (Podcast)
item.description: Michael Cembalest has been an investment analyst for almost 40 years and his research notes have drawn a cult following on Wall Street. He’s known for going super deep into a wide range of topics, like energy and healthcare. And lately he’s been writing a lot about AI, with a particular interest in figuring out whether all the investment in data centers and compute will translate into actual profits. On this episode, we talk to the chair of market and investment strategy for JPMorgan Asset Manag
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

item.title: Northrop Grumman Invests in Defense-Focused Space Startup
item.description: A Texas startup that landed a spacecraft on the moon in March is deepening its ties with Northrop Grumman Corp. to develop a rocket capable of competing against Elon Musk’s SpaceX for some US Department of Defense missions.
item.dc:creator: Bruce Einhorn

media:content.media:description: A rendering of the Eclipse, a rocket being co-developed by Firefly Aerospace and Northrop Grumman.

item.title: Salesforce Shows AI Traction But Fails to Quiet Growth Fears
item.description: Salesforce Inc. reported signs of traction in its new AI products, but that wasn’t enough to ease investor anxieties over a long trend of slowing revenue growth.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: Marc Benioff, chief executive officer of Salesforce Inc., speaks during a keynote at the 2024 Dreamforce conference in San Francisco, California, US, on Tuesday, Sept. 17, 2024. Salesforce is unveiling a pivot in its artificial intelligence strategy this week at its annual Dreamforce conference, now saying that its AI tools can handle tasks without human supervision and changing the way it charges for software.

item.title: Santander Weighs Crypto Push With Early-Stage Stablecoin Plans
item.description: Banco Santander SA is mulling an expansion in digital assets, including early-stage plans to offer a stablecoin as well as access to cryptocurrencies for retail clients of its digital bank, as European lenders push deeper into the sector.
item.dc:creator: Anna Irrera

media:content.media:description: A Banco Santander SA bank branch in Madrid, Spain, on Wednesday, April 30, 2025. Spain is the standout performer among the euro area’s biggest countries and saw its 2025 outlook upgraded last week by the International Monetary Fund.

item.title: Khosla-Led Deal Values Data Startup ClickHouse at $6.35 Billion
item.description: The would-be Snowflake competitor has raised $350 million from investors.
item.dc:creator: Anne VanderMey, Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: Aaron Katz, Yury Izrailevsky and Alexey Milovidov. ClickHouse

item.title: Amazon-Owned Blink Debuts Doorbell Cam With Wider View, Person Detection
item.description: Blink, the Amazon.com Inc.-owned hardware brand known for its connected doorbells and video cameras, introduced new devices on Thursday, the latest entries in a saturated market for smart-home gadgets.
item.dc:creator: Chris Welch

media:content.media:description: Blink’s latest Video Doorbell is priced at $69.99.

item.title: Solar Firm Zeo Buying Heliogen in Bid to Power Data Centers
item.description: Residential solar company Zeo Energy Corp. is acquiring Heliogen Inc. for $10 million as it tries to position itself to help meet surging demand from data centers.
item.dc:creator: Mark Chediak

media:content.media:description: A worker installs solar panels onto the rooftop of a residential property.

item.title: Best Buy Falls After Trimming Outlook on Hit From Tariffs
item.description: Best Buy Co. reduced its sales and profit outlook in response to US tariffs. But in a sign of the trade war’s volatility, that forecast might soon be outdated after a US court on Wednesday struck down many of President Donald Trump’s levies.
item.dc:creator: Will Kubzansky

media:content.media:description: A shopper inside a Best Buy store in California, US. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: HP Plunges After Cutting Profit Outlook on Tariffs, Economy
item.description: Shares of HP Inc. dropped as much as 13% on Thursday after the company issued a weak profit outlook and cut its annual earnings forecast, pointing toward a weaker economy and continuing impact from US tariffs against China.
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: Enrique Lores, president and chief executive officer of HP Inc., during the Computex conference in Taipei, Taiwan, on Monday, June 3, 2024. The trade show runs through June 7.

item.title: New York Times Agrees to License Content to Amazon for AI Use
item.description: The New York Times Co. has reached a deal to license its editorial content to Amazon.com Inc. for use across its artificial intelligence platforms, marking the first such agreement the newspaper company has struck after years of battles between the media and a new, disruptive technology.
item.dc:creator: Molly Schuetz

media:content.media:description: The New York Times building in New York City.

item.title: Nvidia Eases Concerns About China With Upbeat Sales Forecast
item.description: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang soothed investor fears about a China slowdown by delivering a solid sales forecast, saying that the AI computing market is still poised for “exponential growth.”
item.dc:creator: Ian King

item.title: Buyout Firm Vista to Acquire EQT’s Acumatica in $2 Billion Deal
item.description: Vista Equity Partners agreed to acquire Acumatica Inc., a software company that helps businesses streamline workflows.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould, Swetha Gopinath
